statements.name: PROC GMAP
statements.description: Identifies the map data set and the response data set that contain the variables associated with the map. The statement also provides the option to display all map areas and to specify annotation and an output catalog.

statements.name: ID
statements.description: Identifies the variable or variables in the input data set(s) that define map areas.

statements.name: AREA
statements.description: applies color to the regions in BLOCK and PRISM maps based on values of a specified response variable.

statements.name: BLOCK
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional block maps on which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by blocks (bars) of varying height, pattern, and color.

statements.name: CHORO
statements.description: Creates two-dimensional maps in which values of the specified response variables are represented by varying patterns and colors.

statements.name: PRISM
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional prism maps in which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by polyhedrons (raised polygons) of varying height, pattern, and color.

statements.name: SURFACE
statements.description: Creates three-dimensional surface maps in which levels of magnitude of the specified response variables are represented by spikes of varying height.

statements.name: ATTRIB
statements.description: Associates a format, informat, label, and length with one or more variables.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Orders the output according to the BY groups.

statements.name: LABEL
statements.help:
Form 1: Creates a descriptive label for one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1=’text-string’ < ...variable-n=’text-string>; 
Form 2: Removes the label from one or more variables.
LABEL variable-1 = ' ' < ...variable-n=’ ‘>; | variable-1 = < ...variable-n= >

statements.name: NOTE
statements.description: Control the content, appearance, and placement of text.

statements.name: QUIT
statements.description: Executes any statements that have not executed and ends the procedure step.

statements.name: WHERE
statements.description: Subsets the input data set by specifying certain conditions that each observation must meet before it is available for processing.
